citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two dogs have been identified at the facility as requiring veterinary care. The facility did not identify the veterinary issues
prior to the inspection.
A white female poochon Emma (microchip number 7192) approximately 4 years old, has severe gum recession on the
lower jaw and two loose bottom teeth. While performing the physical examination of the dog the inspector observed
movement in the teeth when minimum pressure was applied on the bottom gum. There is excessive brown/black tarter
buildup at the base of the teeth near the gumline. The dog reacted to the examination of the mouth by pulling its head
away from the inspector when touched and whelping.
A grey female shih-poo named Pepsi (microchip number 2413) approximately 2.5 years old, has severe gum recession on
the lower jaw. While performing the physical examination of the dog the inspector observed movement in the front lower
teeth when minimal pressure was applied to the gum. The teeth also had brown/black tarter buildup at the base near the
gumline. The front lower teeth are loose, the dog did not react to examination of the mouth.
Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to assess the health and well-being of the dogs with direct and frequent
communication to the attending veterinarian, can delay treatment leading to the condition getting worse and delays in
healing.
The facility took both dogs to the veterinary clinic for evaluation following the inspection.
Correct by ensuring that the animal listed above, and the condition of the animal are reported to the attending veterinarian
so that the animals can be properly examined, diagnosed, and treated. Additionally, ensure that daily observation of
animals is adequate to identify any signs of poor health. Ensure that there is accurate and timely communication of
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5:00 PM, 11-
Feburary-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with The Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two dogs have been identified at the facility as requiring veterinary care. The facility did not identify the veterinary issues 
prior to the inspection.  
 
A white female poochon Emma (microchip number 7192) approximately 4 years old, has severe gum recession on the 
lower jaw and two loose bottom teeth. While performing the physical examination of the dog the inspector observed 
movement in the teeth when minimum pressure was applied on the bottom gum. There is excessive brown/black tarter 
buildup at the base of the teeth near the gumline. The dog reacted to the examination of the mouth by pulling its head 
away from the inspector when touched and whelping.  
 
A grey female shih-poo named Pepsi (microchip number 2413) approximately 2.5 years old, has severe gum recession on 
the lower jaw. While performing the physical examination of the dog the inspector observed movement in the front lower 
teeth when minimal pressure was applied to the gum. The teeth also had brown/black tarter buildup at the base near the 
gumline. The front lower teeth are loose, the dog did not react to examination of the mouth. 
 
Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to assess the health and well-being of the dogs with direct and frequent 
communication to the attending veterinarian, can delay treatment leading to the condition getting worse and delays in 
healing. 
 
The facility took both dogs to the veterinary clinic for evaluation following the inspection.  
 
Correct by ensuring that the animal listed above, and the condition of the animal are reported to the attending veterinarian 
so that the animals can be properly examined, diagnosed, and treated. Additionally, ensure that daily observation of 
animals is adequate to identify any signs of poor health. Ensure that there is accurate and timely communication of 
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5:00 PM, 11-
Feburary-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with The Facility Representative.

n
